bibl.title: Intrigue in the Cloister: PGM LXVI.
bibl.note: P.G.M. LXVI stems from a Christian milieu, quite possibly from a church or monastery (fourth-sixth c.). The text is accompanied by a drawing of two naked men. Professional - rather than homosexual - jealousy is the motivation of the spell.
DANIEL Robert W., Intrigue in the Cloister: PGM LXVI.
